ca.uqac.lif.labpal

Class Formatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.labpal.Formatter

  • public class Formatter
extends Object
    Provides various utility methods for formatting things into character strings.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      • format

        public static String format(Number n,
                            String format_string)
        Formats a number into a character string using a "printf" format string
        Parameters:
        n - The number
        format_string - The format string
        Returns:
        The formatted number

      • divide

        public static float divide(Number n,
                           Number d)
        Computes the ratio n/d. The purpose of this method is to avoid writing lots of checks for these cases:
        • If either n or d are null, returns 0
        • If d = 0, returns 0
        Parameters:
        n -
        d -
        Returns:
        The ratio n/d, cast as a float

      • sigDig

        public static float sigDig(Number n,
                           int digits)
        Rounds a value to a given number of significant digits. Please remind that significant digits is not the same thing as the number of decimal figures of a number.

        The name of the method is made purposefully short, as it is expected to be used very often in some parts of someone's code.

        Parameters:
        n - The value to be rounded
        digits - The number of significant digits. Must be a positive integer.
        Returns:
        The rounded number

      • sigDig

        public static float sigDig(Number n)
        Rounds a value to three significant digits. This method may be slightly more efficient than calling sigDig(n, 3), as it reuses an internal object instead of creating one upon every new call.
        Parameters:
        n - The value to be rounded
        Returns:
        The rounded number
        See Also:
        sigDig(Number, int)

      • asString

        public static String asString(Object o)
        Converts an object into a string
        Parameters:
        o - The object
        Returns:
        The string

      • jsonCast

        public static ca.uqac.lif.json.JsonElement jsonCast(Object o)
        Casts a value into the most appropriate JSON element type. The method uses the following rules:
        • Any JsonElement is left as is
        • A null becomes a JsonNull
        • Any Number becomes a JsonNumber
        • Any String is first attempted to be interpreted as a number; if so, it becomes a JsonNumber; otherwise, it becomes a JsonString
        • Anything else is converted to a JsonString using the object's toString() method
        Parameters:
        o - The value
        Returns:
        The corresponding JSON element

      • stringToNumber

        public static Number stringToNumber(String value)
        Attempts to create a number object out of a string
        Parameters:
        value - The input string
        Returns:
        A number of the operation succeeded, null otherwise

      • getStringOrNumber

        public static Object getStringOrNumber(String value)
        Attempts to create a number out of a string; if unsuccessful, returns the string.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to try to convert
        Returns:
        The converted value

        public static float getFloat(Number n)
